Description: Fragment of Egyptian terracotta figure. Upper part of a individual carrying a woven basket over left arm, with right arm bent onto chest. At front of figure, belly button seems to be indicated. Hair or headdress arranged in two bun on the sides of head, at the top is a smooth cap of hair (or is it covered by a cloth?). Lower part missing, broken off at the hips. Mould-made, back plain, seam visible along sides of figure. Traces of white slip (?). Red-brown to grey micaceous Nile silt, with some large lime inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bolton Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Similar fisherman (?) with basket from Naukratis (British Museum GR 1886,0401.1444) dated to the 3rd to 2nd centuries BC. However the style and Roman period dress, suggests a late 1st or 2nd century AD date for this. See parallel in Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA668).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.345) (Phase 1)
